items: Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart and hold a dumbbell in one hand at shoulder level, with your elbow bent and your palm facing forward.
Press the dumbbell up and overhead, straightening your arm and keeping your core engaged.
Lower the dumbbell back down to shoulder level, keeping your elbow close to your body.
Repeat for the desired number of reps, then switch sides and repeat with the other arm.
Targets the shoulder muscles, specifically the anterior and medial deltoids
Improves shoulder strength and stability
Helps to correct muscle imbalances between the left and right shoulders
Engages the core muscles for added stability and balance
Allows for unilateral training, which can help to improve overall strength and muscle development
Can be modified to target different areas of the shoulder by adjusting the angle of the press
Deltoids
Triceps
Trapezius
Rotator Cuff
Dumbbell One Arm Shoulder Press
Dumbbell Seated One Arm Shoulder Press
Dumbbell Standing One Arm Shoulder Press
Dumbbell Arnold Press
Dumbbell Push Press
Dumbbell Front Raise to Shoulder Press
Dumbbell Lateral Raise to Shoulder Press
